data.title: House of Assembly
data.meta_description: House of Assembly of Newfoundland and Labrador, Legislature. Proceedings
data.text:
Pam Parsons

Harbour Grace - Port de Grave

Liberal

Minister Responsible for Women and Gender Equality

Profile

Pam Parsons was raised in Spaniard's Bay and is now pleased to call Bay Roberts home. Prior to becoming an MHA, Pam completed her degree in Political Science at Mount Saint Vincent University and a program in Radio Television Arts at the Nova Scotia Community College. With more than a decade of work experience as a Journalist under her belt, Pam turned her attention to politics, winning the seat for the District of Harbour Grace - Port de Grave in 2015. She was re-elected in 2019 and 2021. Pam has served as the Parliamentary Secretary to the Department of Transportation and Works, was the Deputy Chair of Committees, and served as Deputy Speaker of the House of Assembly. She currently serves as the Provincial Representative Commonwealth Women's Parliamentarians Canada. On April 8, 2021, Pam was sworn in as Minister Responsible for Women and Gender Equality.

District Party Start Date End Date Harbour Grace - Port de Grave Liberal February 13, 2021 Current Member Harbour Grace - Port de Grave Liberal May 16, 2019 January 15, 2021 Harbour Grace - Port de Grave Liberal November 30, 2015 April 17, 2019

Responsibility Start Date End Date Minister Responsible for Women and Gender Equality April 2021 Current Management Commission Member (per House of Assembly Accountability, Integrity and Administration Act, s.18(3) & s.18(6)) September 2020 April 2021 Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Transportation and Works May 2019 August 2020 Deputy Chair of Committees November 2018 April 2019
